Standard_Text: Understand how media affects the telling of a story and transmission of information (e.g., illustrations, photographs, music, video).
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Portray information visually to convey the main idea and supporting details about a topic.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Appreciate and respond to creative expressions of information:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Inform others creatively when new information about an area of interest is learned.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Share the source of the information obtained.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Seek, produce, and share information:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Select and use resources in a variety of formats to support personal interests, recreational goals, and pursuits.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Read a good representation of grade-level-appropriate text, making progress toward the goal of reading 500,000 words annually by grade four (e.g., classic and contemporary literature, magazines, newspapers, online information).
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Read widely and use various media for information, personal interest, and lifelong learning:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Students integrate information literacy skills into all areas of learning.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use a diagram or chart to illustrate a presentation.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Communicate with other students to explore options to a problem or an ending to a story.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Record and present information with pictures, bar graphs, numbers, or written statements.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Present information to convey the main idea and supporting details about a topic.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use information and technology creatively to answer a question, solve a problem, or enrich understanding:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Present information drawn from two sources.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Draw conclusions and make informed decisions:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Adhere to privacy (nondisclosure of personal or family information) and safety guidelines (laws and policies) when using the Internet at school or home.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Understand that just as there are strangers in the real world, there are also strangers on the Internet.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate basic knowledge of the district or school's acceptable-use policy.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Recognize that both the author and illustrator have ownership of their own creation.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate proper procedures and good citizenship in the library and online.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate ethical, legal, and safe use of information in print, media, and online resources:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Students use information.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Recognize the need for additional information to answer questions posed by others.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Consider the need for additional information:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate the ability to distinguish between information and advertisements.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify the purpose of an advertisement, including Internet pop-ups.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Assess the comprehensiveness, currency, credibility, authority, and accuracy of resources:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Understand that the Internet contains accurate and inaccurate information.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Review facts and details to clarify and organize ideas for notetaking.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Draw meaning from illustrations, photographs, diagrams, charts, graphs, maps, and captions.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Determine the relevance of the information:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Students evaluate information.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify nonfiction text structures in print and digital formats (e.g., main idea and supporting details, cause and effect, compare and contrast, sequencing).
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify main ideas of a text in preparation for notetaking.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify when it is necessary to ask an appropriate adult for assistance in seeking information in both digital and print environments.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Connect prior knowledge to the information and events in text and digital formats.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify trusted and knowledgeable people to ask for assistance with an information search (e.g., teacher, teacher librarian, family member).
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify trusted places in the community where students can seek information(e.g., home, school, museums, governmental agencies, public libraries).
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Retrieve information in a timely, safe, and responsible manner:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use graphic elements and navigational tools (e.g., buttons, icons, fields) of computer software.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify the parts of a book (print and digital): table of contents, glossary, index, and dedication.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify types of everyday print, media, and digital resources by using academic vocabulary (e.g., biography, periodical, database, fiction, nonfiction, primary source).
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Alphabetize beyond the initial letter to locate resources.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Locate age-appropriate fiction and nonfiction print, media, and digital resources in the school library.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify whom to ask for help when using the Internet at the school library or in the classroom.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Independently check out and care for a variety of library resources, including technology devices.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify two sources of information that may provide an answer to the question(s).
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify and locate a variety of resources online and in other formats by using effective search strategies:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Understand the concept of key words.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Develop questions that define the scope of investigation and connect them to the topic.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Formulate appropriate questions:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Organize prior knowledge of a subject, problem, or question (e.g., create a chart).
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify a simple problem or question that needs information.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Recognize the need for information:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Students access information.
